intro: Aragallus abbreviatus, commonly known as the dwarf aragallus, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with slender stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and are usually pink or red in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
